pull.title: ci: Fix image caching and apply other improvements
pull.body:
This PR fixes an issue where only the latest image cache was available.

For other minor improvements, see the individual commit messages.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

ci: Add `scope` parameter to `cache-{to,from}` options

This change fixes an issue where only the latest image cache was
available.

ci: Drop `tags` input for `docker/build-push-action`

The `tags` input is unused for caching.

ci: Set `DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive`

This suppresses `debconf: unable to initialize frontend: ...` warnings.

events.message:
ci: Set `DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive`

This suppresses `debconf: unable to initialize frontend: ...` warnings.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,25 +14,23 @@ runs:
   steps:
     - uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 
-    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
+    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
       id: main_builder
       continue-on-error: true
       with:
         context: .
         file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile }}
-        tags: ${{ inputs.tag }}
comments.body: Even after looking at the docs, I'm not sure what the `tags` parameter is actually supposed to do. Did you figure this out?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,25 +14,23 @@ runs:
   steps:
     - uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 
-    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
+    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
       id: main_builder
       continue-on-error: true
       with:
         context: .
         file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile }}
-        tags: ${{ inputs.tag }}
         load: true
-        cache-from: type=gha
+        cache-from: type=gha,scope=${{ runner.arch }}
comments.body: Would it be a good idea to add `{{input.tag}}` here (and maybe rename `tag` to `scope`)?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,8 @@ description: 'Run a command in a Docker container, while passing explicitly set
 inputs:
   dockerfile:
     description: 'A Dockerfile that defines an image'
-    required: true
-  tag:
-    description: 'A tag of an image'
-    required: true
+    required: false
+    default: ./ci/linux-debian.Dockerfile
comments.body: I'm not sure if this is a reasonable default. I mean, yes, this is what we always use. But currently, this action is not specific to libsecp256k1 at all, and I think it would be nice to keep it that way.
I think this is not a good idea because the Dockerfile can also be used interactively on a developer's machine. See https://serverfault.com/a/797318

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,25 +14,23 @@ runs:
   steps:
     - uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 
-    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
+    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
       id: main_builder
       continue-on-error: true
       with:
         context: .
         file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile }}
-        tags: ${{ inputs.tag }}
comments.body: It's meant to be used when exporting a built image to a registry.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,25 +14,23 @@ runs:
   steps:
     - uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 
-    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
+    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
       id: main_builder
       continue-on-error: true
       with:
         context: .
         file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile }}
-        tags: ${{ inputs.tag }}
         load: true
-        cache-from: type=gha
+        cache-from: type=gha,scope=${{ runner.arch }}
comments.body: I don't think so. Tags are not used for caching.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,8 @@ description: 'Run a command in a Docker container, while passing explicitly set
 inputs:
   dockerfile:
     description: 'A Dockerfile that defines an image'
-    required: true
-  tag:
-    description: 'A tag of an image'
-    required: true
+    required: false
+    default: ./ci/linux-debian.Dockerfile
comments.body: It seems unlikely that this action would be reused elsewhere.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,25 +14,23 @@ runs:
   steps:
     - uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 
-    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
+    - uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
       id: main_builder
       continue-on-error: true
       with:
         context: .
         file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile }}
-        tags: ${{ inputs.tag }}
         load: true
-        cache-from: type=gha
+        cache-from: type=gha,scope=${{ runner.arch }}
comments.body:
I think we're talking past each other. (But sorry, my message was very unclear.) My suggestion is to add an input parameter to the `run-in-docker-action` that is used as a prefix to `scope`, i.e., the caller sets the `scope`.

In our case, the caller could then set scope=`ci-image-${{ runner.arch }}` or something like this.
